Articles.Content:
So, what are they? My two top ones are probably October Sky and Jean de Florette.

October Sky because of the content (Rocketry/Space) and how well it was done, and Jean de Florette simply because it\'s an amazing film, glad our French teacher showed it to us.
Star Wars 4,5, and 6, Blade Runner, The Fifth Element, Dark City and all the Alien movies

2001: A Space Odyssey

The CG is great, especially considering that it was produced in the late 60\'s.

All Star Wars movies, because a true fan likes them all.

In addition, all PotC and Harry Potter movies too.

All Star Wars movies, because a true fan likes them all.

A true fan hates the remastered old trilogy (the one with some new CGI etc.) because it denies the entire expanded universe :\'( (party on Coruscant after the emperor\'s death? no no no!)

Ok, the list:

Star Wars, The Fountain, Matrix, Sunshine, and a few more
Apollo 13. It\'s simply the best, most accurate take on space that has ever been committed to film.

Ultramarine!

http://ultramarinesthemovie.com/index.php

(Haven\'t actually seen it, posting for luigi\'s benefit)

My favourite films are starwars episdodes 2 and 5.

But I\'m partial to all fantasy/sci-fi/space films.

I was gonna see Ultramarine, even planning on getting the Special Edition DVD.

Then I forgot about it for a few months. Then I was too late. :\'C
Paul, Shaun of the Dead, Hot Fuzz, X-Files both movies.

I have a lot of favourite movies! a small selection:

The Right Stuff

Apollo 13

Moon

The Fifth Element

From the Earth to the Moon [HBO miniseries - same team as did Apollo13...Ron Howard/Tom Hanks]

Star Trek/Star Wars

Casshern

Dark City [director\'s cut]

Aliens [director\'s cut]

Alien Resurrection

Aeon Flux

Avatar

District 9

Galaxy Quest!

Iron Man 1 & 2

Pandorum

Watchmen

WALL-E

Crying Freeman

Amelie

Delicatessen

...some nice ones to try in that lot

Joe 8)
